134/**
135 *  The annotation processor for the {@code org.tquadrat.foundation.config}
136 *  module.
137 *
138 *  @version $Id: ConfigAnnotationProcessor.java 946 2021-12-23 14:48:19Z tquadrat $
139 *
140 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
141 *  @UMLGraph.link
142 *  @since 0.1.0
143 */
144@SuppressWarnings( {"OverlyCoupledClass", "OverlyComplexClass"} )
145@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: ConfigAnnotationProcessor.java 946 2021-12-23 14:48:19Z tquadrat $" )
146@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
147@SupportedSourceVersion( SourceVersion.RELEASE_17 )
148@SupportedOptions( { APBase.ADD_DEBUG_OUTPUT, APBase.MAVEN_GOAL } )
149public class ConfigAnnotationProcessor extends APBase

529
530        /*---------*\
531    ====** Methods **==========================================================
532        \*---------*/
533    /**
534     *  Checks whether the given type name is inappropriate for a configuration
535     *  bean property and deserves that an
536     *  {@link InappropriateTypeError}
537     *  is thrown.
538     *
539     *  @param  typeName    The type name to check.
540     *  @throws InappropriateTypeError  The given type may not be chosen for
541     *      a configuration bean property.
542     *
543     *  @see    InputStream
544     *  @see    Stream
545     *  @see    DoubleStream
546     *  @see    IntStream
547     *  @see    LongStream
548     */
549    private static final void checkAppropriate( final TypeName typeName ) throws InappropriateTypeError
550    {
551        if( !(typeName.isPrimitive() || typeName.isBoxedPrimitive()) )
552        {
553            //---* InputStream and the "primitive" Streams are not allowed *---
554            if( typeName.equals( TypeName.from( DoubleStream.class ) )
555                || typeName.equals( TypeName.from( IntStream.class ) )
556                || typeName.equals( TypeName.from( LongStream.class ) )
557                || typeName.equals( TypeName.from( InputStream.class ) ) )
558            {
559                throw new InappropriateTypeError( typeName );
560            }
561
562            //noinspection ChainOfInstanceofChecks
563            if( typeName instanceof ParameterizedTypeName parameterizedTypeName )
564            {
565                //---* Stream is not allowed *---------------------------------
566                if( parameterizedTypeName.rawType().equals( TypeName.from( Stream.class ) ) )
567                {
568                    throw new InappropriateTypeError( typeName );
569                }
570            }
571
572            /*
573             * Classes that are derived from InputStream or implement stream
574             * are not allowed.
575             */
576            if( typeName instanceof ClassName className )
577            {
578                loadClass( className.canonicalName() ).ifPresent( c ->
579                {
580                    if( Stream.class.isAssignableFrom( c ) || InputStream.class.isAssignableFrom( c ) )
581                    {
582                        throw new InappropriateTypeError( typeName );
583                    }
584                } );
585            }
586        }
587    }   //  checkAppropriate()
588
589    /**
590     *  <p>{@summary Composes an argument name from the given formal
591     *  parameter.}</p>
592     *  <p>Setters and 'add' methods use internal variables whose names can
593     *  conflict with the names of the formal parameters, as the latter can be
594     *  chosen freely by the user. Therefore this method will prefix the given
595     *  formal parameter name with &quot;{@code ;_$}&quot; to avoid any
596     *  possible collision.</p>
597     *
598     *  @param  parameter   The formal parameter.
599     *  @return The argument name.
600     */
601    private static final String composeArgumentName( final VariableElement parameter )
602    {
603        final var retValue = composeArgumentName( requireNonNullArgument( parameter, "parameter" ).getSimpleName() );
604
605        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
606        return retValue;
607    }   //  composeArgumentName()
608
609    /**
610     *  <p>{@summary Composes an argument name from the given formal
611     *  parameter.}</p>
612     *  <p>Setters and 'add' methods use internal variables whose names can
613     *  conflict with the names of the formal parameters, as the latter can be
614     *  chosen freely by the user. Therefore this method will prefix the given
615     *  formal parameter name with &quot;{@code ;_$}&quot; to avoid any
616     *  possible collision.</p>
617     *
618     *  @param  parameter   The formal parameter.
619     *  @return The argument name.
620     */
621    private static final String composeArgumentName( final CharSequence parameter )
622    {
623        final var retValue = format( "_$%s", requireNotEmptyArgument( parameter, "parameter" ) );
624
625        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
626        return retValue;
627    }   //  composeArgumentName()
628
629    /**
630     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves the name of the property from the name of the
631     *  given executable element for a method that is either a getter, a setter
632     *  or an 'add' method.}</p>
633     *  <p>Alternatively the method has an annotation that provides the name of
634     *  the property.</p>
635     *
636     *  @param  method  The method.
637     *  @return The name of the property.
638     *
639     *  @see PropertyName
640     *  @see SpecialProperty
641     *  @see SpecialPropertyType
642     */
643    private final String determinePropertyNameFromMethod( @SuppressWarnings( "TypeMayBeWeakened" ) final ExecutableElement method )
644    {
645        final String retValue;
646        final var specialPropertyAnnotation = method.getAnnotation( SpecialProperty.class );
647        final var propertyNameAnnotation = method.getAnnotation( PropertyName.class );
648        if( nonNull( specialPropertyAnnotation ) )
649        {
650            if( nonNull( propertyNameAnnotation ) )
651            {
652                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, PropertyName.class.getName(), method.getSimpleName() ) );
653            }
654            final var specialPropertyType = specialPropertyAnnotation.value();
655            retValue = specialPropertyType.getPropertyName();
656        }
657        else
658        {
659            if( nonNull( propertyNameAnnotation ) )
660            {
661                retValue = propertyNameAnnotation.value();
662            }
663            else
664            {
665                final var methodName = method.getSimpleName().toString();
666
667                /*
668                 * We know that the method is either a getter, a setter or an 'add'
669                 * method. Therefore, we know also that the name starts either with
670                 * "get", "set", "add" or "is".
671                 */
672                final var pos = methodName.startsWith( PREFIX_IS ) ? PREFIX_IS.length() : PREFIX_GET.length();
673                retValue = decapitalize( methodName.substring( pos ) );
674            }
675        }
676
677        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
678        return retValue;
679    }   //  determinePropertyNameFromMethod()
680
681    /**
682     *  <p>{@summary Determines the property type from the return type of the
683     *  given getter.}</p>
684     *  <p>Usually this will be the return type as is, only in case of
685     *  {@link Optional},
686     *  it will be the parameter type.</p>
687     *
688     *  @param  getter  The getter to inspect.
689     *  @return The property type.
690     */
691    private static final TypeName determinePropertyType( final ExecutableElement getter )
692    {
693        var retValue = TypeName.from( requireNonNullArgument( getter, "getter" ).getReturnType() );
694        if( retValue instanceof ParameterizedTypeName returnType )
695        {
696            if( returnType.rawType().equals( TypeName.from( Optional.class ) ) )
697            {
698                retValue = returnType.typeArguments().get( 0 );
699            }
700        }
701
702        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
703        return retValue;
704    }   //  determinePropertyType()
705
706    /**
707     *  {@inheritDoc}
708     */
709    @Override
710    protected final Collection<Class<? extends Annotation>> getSupportedAnnotationClasses()
711    {
712        final Collection<Class<? extends Annotation>> retValue = List.of( ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class, MessagePrefix.class, BaseBundleName.class );
713
714        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
715        return retValue;
716    }   //  getSupportedAnnotationClasses()
717
718    /**
719     *  Processes the given
720     *  {@link ExecutableElement}
721     *  instance for an 'add' method.
722     *
723     *  @param  configuration   The code generation configuration.
724     *  @param  addMethod   The 'add' method.
725     */
726    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
727    private final void handleAddMethod( final CodeGenerationConfiguration configuration, final ExecutableElement addMethod )
728    {
729        //---* Get the method name *-------------------------------------------
730        final var addMethodName = addMethod.getSimpleName();
731
732        //---* Check for unwanted annotations *--------------------------------
733        @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
734        Class<? extends Annotation> [] unwantedAnnotations = new Class[]
735        {
736            SystemProperty.class,
737            EnvironmentVariable.class,
738            SystemPreference.class,
739            Preference.class,
740            NoPreference.class,
741            Argument.class,
742            Option.class,
743            INIValue.class
744        };
745        for( final var annotationClass : unwantedAnnotations )
746        {
747            if( nonNull( addMethod.getAnnotation( annotationClass ) ) )
748            {
749                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnAddMethod, annotationClass.getName(), addMethodName ) );
750            }
751        }
752
753        /*
754         * If the 'add' method is default, our job is mostly done already.
755         */
756        final var isDefault = addMethod.getModifiers().contains( DEFAULT );
757        if( isDefault )
758        {
759            //noinspection unchecked
760            unwantedAnnotations = new Class[]
761                {
762                    CheckEmpty.class,
763                    CheckNull.class,
764                    SpecialProperty.class
765                };
766            for( final var annotationClass : unwantedAnnotations )
767            {
768                if( nonNull( addMethod.getAnnotation( annotationClass ) ) )
769                {
770                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnAddMethod, annotationClass.getName(), addMethodName ) );
771                }
772            }
773        }
774        else
775        {
776            //---* Get the property name *-------------------------------------
777            final var propertyName = determinePropertyNameFromMethod( addMethod );
778
779            /*
780             * As we cannot infer the property type from an add method, it is
781             * required that we already have a property specification for this
782             * property.
783             */
784            final var property = (PropertySpecImpl) configuration.getProperty( propertyName )
785                .orElseThrow( () -> new org.tquadrat.foundation.ap.CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_MissingPropertyDefinition, propertyName, addMethodName ) ) );
786
787            //---* Only collections may have 'add' methods *-------------------
788            if( property.getCollectionKind() == NO_COLLECTION )
789            {
790                throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoCollection, addMethodName, propertyName ) );
791            }
792
793            //---* Immutable special properties may not have an add method *---
794            if( property.hasFlag( PROPERTY_IS_SPECIAL ) )
795            {
796                property.getSpecialPropertyType()
797                    .map( CodeGenerator::getSpecialPropertySpecification )
798                    .filter( spec -> spec.hasFlag( PROPERTY_IS_MUTABLE ) )
799                    .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_IllegalMutator, propertyName ) ) );
800            }
801
802            //---* Save the method name and variable name *--------------------
803            property.setAddMethodName( addMethodName );
804            final var argumentName = composeArgumentName( addMethod.getParameters().get( 0 ) );
805            property.setAddMethodArgumentName( argumentName );
806
807            //---* We have an add method, so the property is mutable *---------
808            property.setFlag( PROPERTY_IS_MUTABLE );
809            if( configuration.getSynchronizationRequired() ) property.setFlag( PROPERTY_REQUIRES_SYNCHRONIZATION );
810
811            /*
812             * For a special property, all the definitions are made there, so
813             * nothing to do here â¦
814             */
815            if( !property.hasFlag( PROPERTY_IS_SPECIAL ) )
816            {
817                final var propertyType = property.getPropertyType();
818                if( isNull( propertyType ) )
819                {
820                    throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoType, addMethodName, propertyName ) );
821                }
822
823                /*
824                 * 'add' methods are only allowed (useful?) for properties that are
825                 * collections.
826                 */
827                if( CollectionKind.determine( propertyType ) == NO_COLLECTION )
828                {
829                    throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_AddMethodNotAllowed, addMethodName ) );
830                }
831
832                /*
833                 * Get the StringConverter; as this cannot be inferred it has to be
834                 * taken from the annotation @StringConversion, if present. And
835                 * then it will override the already set one.
836                 */
837                configuration.extractStringConverterClass( addMethod )
838                    .ifPresent( property::setStringConverterClass );
839            }
840
841            /*
842             * Shall the property be added to the result of toString()?
843             */
844            if( nonNull( addMethod.getAnnotation( ExemptFromToString.class ) ) )
845            {
846                property.setFlag( EXEMPT_FROM_TOSTRING );
847            }
848
849            //---* â¦ and now we create the method spec *-----------------------
850            final var methodBuilder = configuration.getComposer().overridingMethodBuilder( addMethod )
851                .addAnnotation( Override.class );
852            property.setAddMethodBuilder( methodBuilder );
853        }
854    }   //  handleAddMethod()
855
856    /**
857     *  Processes the given
858     *  {@link ExecutableElement}
859     *  instance for a getter method.
860     *
861     *  @param  configuration   The code generation configuration.
862     *  @param  getter  The getter method.
863     */
864    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
865    private final void handleGetter( final CodeGenerationConfiguration configuration, final ExecutableElement getter )
866    {
867        //---* Get the property name *-----------------------------------------
868        final var propertyName = determinePropertyNameFromMethod( getter );
869
870        /*
871         * Create the new property spec and store it. The getters will be
872         * created first, so a property with the same name, defined by another
873         * getter, may not exist already. The respective check is made on
874         * storing.
875         */
876        final var property = new PropertySpecImpl( propertyName );
877        configuration.addProperty( property );
878
879        //---* Keep the name of the getter method *----------------------------
880        final var getterMethodName = getter.getSimpleName();
881        property.setGetterMethodName( getterMethodName );
882
883        //---* Shall the property be added to the result of toString()? *------
884        if( nonNull( getter.getAnnotation( ExemptFromToString.class ) ) )
885        {
886            property.setFlag( EXEMPT_FROM_TOSTRING );
887        }
888
889        //---* Default getters are handled differently *-----------------------
890        final var isDefault = getter.getModifiers().contains( DEFAULT );
891        if( isDefault )
892        {
893            /*
894             * Several annotations are not allowed for a default getter.
895             */
896            @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
897            final Class<? extends Annotation> [] unwantedAnnotations = new Class[]
898            {
899                SystemProperty.class,
900                EnvironmentVariable.class,
901                SystemPreference.class,
902                Argument.class,
903                Option.class,
904                Preference.class,
905                SpecialProperty.class,
906                INIValue.class
907            };
908            for( final var annotationClass : unwantedAnnotations )
909            {
910                if( nonNull( getter.getAnnotation( annotationClass ) ) )
911                {
912                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, annotationClass.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
913                }
914            }
915            property.setFlag( GETTER_IS_DEFAULT );
916        }
917        var allowsPreferences = !isDefault;
918
919        /*
920         * Some properties are 'special', and that is reflected by the
921         * annotation @SpecialProperty.
922         */
923        final var specialPropertyAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( SpecialProperty.class );
924        if( nonNull( specialPropertyAnnotation ) )
925        {
926            /*
927             * No further analysis required because everything is determined by
928             * the special property spec, even the property name.
929             */
930            property.setSpecialPropertyType( specialPropertyAnnotation.value() );
931        }
932        else
933        {
934            //---* Determine the return type *---------------------------------
935            final var returnType = TypeName.from( getter.getReturnType() );
936            checkAppropriate( returnType );
937            property.setGetterReturnType( returnType );
938
939            //---* Determine the property type *-------------------------------
940            final var propertyType = determinePropertyType( getter );
941            checkAppropriate( propertyType );
942            property.setPropertyType( propertyType );
943            final var collectionKind = CollectionKind.determine( propertyType );
944            property.setCollectionKind( collectionKind );
945
946            /*
947             * Check whether the return type is Optional; only when the return
948             * type is Optional, it can be different from the property type.
949             */
950            if( !returnType.equals( propertyType ) ) property.setFlag( GETTER_RETURNS_OPTIONAL );
951
952            /*
953             * Determine the string converter instance, either from the
954             * annotation or guess it from the property type.
955             */
956            configuration.determineStringConverterClass( getter, propertyType ).ifPresent( property::setStringConverterClass );
957
958            //---* Additional annotations *------------------------------------
959            final Optional<INIValue> iniValue = property.getStringConverterClass().isPresent()
960                ? Optional.ofNullable( getter.getAnnotation( INIValue.class ) )
961                : Optional.empty();
962            iniValue.ifPresent( a ->
963                {
964                    property.setINIConfiguration( a );
965                    property.setFlag( ALLOWS_INIFILE, PROPERTY_IS_MUTABLE );
966                } );
967            allowsPreferences &= iniValue.isEmpty();
968
969            final var systemPropertyAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( SystemProperty.class );
970            if( nonNull( systemPropertyAnnotation ) )
971            {
972                if( iniValue.isPresent() )
973                {
974                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, INIValue.class.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
975                }
976
977                /*
978                 * The property will be initialised from a system property with
979                 * the name given in the annotation.
980                 */
981                property.setSystemPropertyName( systemPropertyAnnotation.value() );
982
983                /*
984                 * System properties may not be stored to/retrieved from
985                 * preferences or an INIFile.
986                 */
987                allowsPreferences = false;
988            }
989
990            final var environmentVariableAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( EnvironmentVariable.class );
991            if( nonNull( environmentVariableAnnotation ) )
992            {
993                if( iniValue.isPresent() )
994                {
995                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, INIValue.class.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
996                }
997
998                /*
999                 * @SystemProperty and @EnvironmentVariable are mutual
1000                 * exclusive.
1001                 */
1002                if( nonNull( systemPropertyAnnotation ) )
1003                {
1004                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, EnvironmentVariable.class.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
1005                }
1006
1007                /*
1008                 * The property will be initialised from an environment
1009                 * variable with the name given in the annotation.
1010                 */
1011                property.setEnvironmentVariableName( environmentVariableAnnotation.value() );
1012
1013                /*
1014                 * Environment variable values may not be stored
1015                 * to/retrieved from preferences.
1016                 */
1017                allowsPreferences = false;
1018            }
1019
1020            final var systemPrefsAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( SystemPreference.class );
1021            if( nonNull( systemPrefsAnnotation ) )
1022            {
1023                /*
1024                 * @INIValue, @SystemProperty, @EnvironmentVariable and
1025                 * @SystemPreference are mutual exclusive.
1026                 */
1027                if( nonNull( systemPropertyAnnotation ) || nonNull( environmentVariableAnnotation ) || iniValue.isPresent() )
1028                {
1029                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, SystemPreference.class.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
1030                }
1031
1032                /*
1033                 * The property will be initialised from an environment
1034                 * variable with the name given in the annotation.
1035                 */
1036                property.setSystemPrefsPath( systemPrefsAnnotation.path() );
1037                final var prefsKey = systemPrefsAnnotation.key();
1038                if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( prefsKey ) )
1039                {
1040                    property.setPrefsKey( prefsKey );
1041                }
1042                else
1043                {
1044                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_PrefsKeyMissing, propertyName ) );
1045                }
1046
1047                final var accessorClass = getAnnotationMirror( getter, SystemPreference.class )
1048                    .flatMap( mirror -> getAnnotationValue( mirror, "accessor" ) )
1049                    .map( annotationValue -> TypeName.from( (TypeMirror) annotationValue.getValue() ) )
1050                    .orElseThrow( () -> new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_AccessorMissing, propertyName ) ) );
1051                property.setPrefsAccessorClass( accessorClass );
1052
1053                /*
1054                 * System preference values may not be stored to/retrieved from
1055                 * preferences.
1056                 */
1057                allowsPreferences = false;
1058            }
1059
1060            //---* Process the CLI annotations *-------------------------------
1061            final var argumentAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( Argument.class );
1062            final var optionAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( Option.class );
1063            if( nonNull( argumentAnnotation) && nonNull( optionAnnotation ) )
1064            {
1065                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( MSG_CLIAnnotationClash, optionAnnotation );
1066            }
1067            if( nonNull( argumentAnnotation ) )
1068            {
1069                parseArgumentAnnotation( argumentAnnotation, getter, property );
1070            }
1071            if( nonNull( optionAnnotation ) )
1072            {
1073                parseOptionAnnotation( optionAnnotation, getter, property );
1074            }
1075
1076            //---* Process the preferences annotations *-----------------------
1077            final var noPreferenceAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( NoPreference.class );
1078            final var preferenceAnnotation = getter.getAnnotation( Preference.class );
1079            if( !allowsPreferences && nonNull( preferenceAnnotation ) )
1080            {
1081                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnGetter, Preference.class.getName(), getter.getSimpleName() ) );
1082            }
1083            if( nonNull(  preferenceAnnotation ) && nonNull( noPreferenceAnnotation ) )
1084            {
1085                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( MSG_PreferenceAnnotationClash, noPreferenceAnnotation );
1086            }
1087            if( nonNull( noPreferenceAnnotation ) ) allowsPreferences = false;
1088            if( allowsPreferences )
1089            {
1090                property.setFlag( ALLOWS_PREFERENCES );
1091
1092                //---* The default values *------------------------------------
1093                var preferenceKey = propertyName;
1094                var accessorClass = PREFS_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
1095
1096                //---* Check the annotation *----------------------------------
1097                if( nonNull( preferenceAnnotation ) )
1098                {
1099                    if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( preferenceAnnotation.key() ) ) preferenceKey = preferenceAnnotation.key();
1100
1101                    try
1102                    {
1103                        final var name = "accessor";
1104                        accessorClass = getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( getter, Preference.class, name )
1105                            .map( TypeName::from )
1106                            .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoValueForMirror, Preference.class.getName(), name ) ) );
1107                    }
1108                    catch( final NoSuchElementException e )
1109                    {
1110                        throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CannotRetrieveMirror, Preference.class.getName() ), e );
1111                    }
1112                }
1113
1114                //---* Translate the default, if required *--------------------
1115                accessorClass = retrieveAccessorClass( accessorClass, propertyType );
1116
1117                //---* Keep the values *---------------------------------------
1118                property.setPrefsKey( preferenceKey );
1119                property.setPrefsAccessorClass( accessorClass );
1120            }
1121
1122            //---* â¦ and now we create the method spec *-------------------
1123            final var methodBuilder = configuration.getComposer().overridingMethodBuilder( getter )
1124                .addAnnotation( Override.class );
1125            property.setGetterBuilder( methodBuilder );
1126        }
1127    }   //  handleGetter()
1128
1129    /**
1130     *  Processes the given
1131     *  {@link ExecutableElement}
1132     *  instance for a setter method.
1133     *
1134     *  @param  configuration   The code generation configuration.
1135     *  @param  setter  The setter method.
1136     */
1137    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1138    private final void handleSetter( final CodeGenerationConfiguration configuration, final ExecutableElement setter )
1139    {
1140        //---* Get the method name *-------------------------------------------
1141        final var setterMethodName = setter.getSimpleName();
1142
1143        //---* Check for unwanted annotations *--------------------------------
1144        @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
1145        final Class<? extends Annotation> [] unwantedAnnotations = new Class[]
1146        {
1147            SystemProperty.class,
1148            EnvironmentVariable.class,
1149            SystemPreference.class,
1150            Argument.class,
1151            Option.class,
1152            INIValue.class
1153        };
1154        for( final var annotationClass : unwantedAnnotations )
1155        {
1156            if( nonNull( setter.getAnnotation( annotationClass ) ) )
1157            {
1158                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, annotationClass.getName(), setterMethodName ) );
1159            }
1160        }
1161
1162        //---* Get the property name *-----------------------------------------
1163        final var propertyName = determinePropertyNameFromMethod( setter );
1164
1165        /*
1166         * Let's see if we have such a property already; if not, we have to
1167         * create it.
1168         */
1169        final PropertySpecImpl property;
1170        final TypeName propertyType;
1171        if( configuration.hasProperty( propertyName ) )
1172        {
1173            try
1174            {
1175                property = (PropertySpecImpl) configuration.getProperty( propertyName ).orElseThrow();
1176            }
1177            catch( final NoSuchElementException e )
1178            {
1179                throw new UnexpectedExceptionError( e );
1180            }
1181            propertyType = property.getPropertyType();
1182
1183            //---* The property type must match the setter argument type *-----
1184            if( !propertyType.equals( TypeName.from( setter.getParameters().get( 0 ).asType() ) ) )
1185            {
1186                throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_TypeMismatch, TypeName.from( setter.getParameters().get( 0 ).asType() ).toString(), setterMethodName, propertyType.toString() ) );
1187            }
1188        }
1189        else
1190        {
1191            property = new PropertySpecImpl( propertyName );
1192            configuration.addProperty( property );
1193            propertyType = TypeName.from( setter.getParameters().get( 0 ).asType() );
1194            property.setPropertyType( propertyType );
1195        }
1196
1197        //---* Immutable special properties may not have a setter *------------
1198        if( property.hasFlag( PROPERTY_IS_SPECIAL ) )
1199        {
1200            property.getSpecialPropertyType()
1201                .map( CodeGenerator::getSpecialPropertySpecification )
1202                .filter( spec -> spec.hasFlag( PROPERTY_IS_MUTABLE ) )
1203                .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_IllegalMutator, propertyName ) ) );
1204        }
1205
1206        //---* There is a setter, so the property is mutable *-----------------
1207        property.setFlag( PROPERTY_IS_MUTABLE );
1208        if( configuration.getSynchronizationRequired() ) property.setFlag( PROPERTY_REQUIRES_SYNCHRONIZATION );
1209
1210        //---* Keep the name of the setter method *----------------------------
1211        property.setSetterMethodName( setterMethodName );
1212
1213        //---* Shall the property be added to the result of toString()? *------
1214        if( nonNull( setter.getAnnotation( ExemptFromToString.class ) ) )
1215        {
1216            property.setFlag( EXEMPT_FROM_TOSTRING );
1217        }
1218
1219        /*
1220         * Default setters are handled differently, and they must have a
1221         * corresponding default getter.
1222         */
1223        final var isDefault = setter.getModifiers().contains( DEFAULT );
1224        if( isDefault)
1225        {
1226            if( property.getGetterMethodName().isEmpty() || !property.hasFlag( GETTER_IS_DEFAULT ) )
1227            {
1228                throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_MissingGetter, propertyName ) );
1229            }
1230            property.setFlag( SETTER_IS_DEFAULT );
1231        }
1232
1233        /*
1234         * If this setter is for a special property, we need to check whether
1235         * we have a getter, and whether that getter is for the same special
1236         * property.
1237         */
1238        final var specialPropertyAnnotation = setter.getAnnotation( SpecialProperty.class );
1239        if( nonNull( specialPropertyAnnotation ) )
1240        {
1241            /*
1242             * A default setter cannot be a setter for a special property.
1243             */
1244            if( isDefault ) throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, SpecialProperty.class.getName(), setterMethodName ) );
1245
1246            final var specialPropertyType = specialPropertyAnnotation.value();
1247            final var specialPropertyTypeOptional = property.getSpecialPropertyType();
1248            if( specialPropertyTypeOptional.isEmpty() )
1249            {
1250                /*
1251                 * No further analysis required because everything is
1252                 * determined by the special property spec, even the property
1253                 * name.
1254                 */
1255                property.setSpecialPropertyType( specialPropertyType );
1256            }
1257            else
1258            {
1259                if( specialPropertyTypeOptional.get() != specialPropertyType )
1260                {
1261                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_SpecialPropertyMismatch, SpecialProperty.class.getName(), setterMethodName, specialPropertyType.name(), specialPropertyTypeOptional.get().name() ) );
1262                }
1263            }
1264        }
1265        else
1266        {
1267            //---* Process the preferences annotations *-----------------------
1268            final var noPreferenceAnnotation = setter.getAnnotation( NoPreference.class );
1269            final var preferenceAnnotation = setter.getAnnotation( Preference.class );
1270            final var allowsPreferences = isNull( noPreferenceAnnotation );
1271
1272            if( nonNull(  preferenceAnnotation ) && nonNull( noPreferenceAnnotation ) )
1273            {
1274                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( MSG_PreferenceAnnotationClash, noPreferenceAnnotation );
1275            }
1276
1277            /*
1278             * If there is a getter for the property, the configuration for
1279             * preferences is already made there.
1280             * For a setter, the preferences annotations are only allowed if
1281             * there is no getter.
1282             */
1283            if( property.getGetterMethodName().isPresent() )
1284            {
1285                /*
1286                 * For a setter, the preferences annotations are only allowed
1287                 * if there is no getter.
1288                 */
1289                if( nonNull( preferenceAnnotation ) || nonNull( noPreferenceAnnotation ) )
1290                {
1291                    final var a = nonNull( preferenceAnnotation ) ? preferenceAnnotation : noPreferenceAnnotation;
1292                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, a.getClass().getName(), setterMethodName ) );
1293                }
1294            }
1295            else
1296            {
1297                if( allowsPreferences )
1298                {
1299                    property.setFlag( ALLOWS_PREFERENCES );
1300
1301                    //---* The default values *--------------------------------
1302                    var preferenceKey = propertyName;
1303                    var accessorClass = PREFS_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
1304
1305                    //---* Check the annotation *------------------------------
1306                    if( nonNull( preferenceAnnotation ) )
1307                    {
1308                        if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( preferenceAnnotation.key() ) ) preferenceKey = preferenceAnnotation.key();
1309
1310                        try
1311                        {
1312                            final var name = "accessor";
1313                            accessorClass = getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( setter, Preference.class, name )
1314                                .map( TypeName::from )
1315                                .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoValueForMirror, Preference.class.getName(), name ) ) );
1316                        }
1317                        catch( final NoSuchElementException e )
1318                        {
1319                            throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CannotRetrieveMirror, Preference.class.getName() ), e );
1320                        }
1321                    }
1322
1323                    //---* Translate the default, if required *--------------------
1324                    accessorClass = retrieveAccessorClass( accessorClass, propertyType );
1325
1326                    //---* Keep the values *-----------------------------------
1327                    property.setPrefsKey( preferenceKey );
1328                    property.setPrefsAccessorClass( accessorClass );
1329                }
1330            }
1331
1332            /*
1333             * Determine the string converter instance, either from the
1334             * annotation or guess it from the property type.
1335             */
1336            final var stringConverterOptional = configuration.determineStringConverterClass( setter, propertyType );
1337            property.getStringConverterClass()
1338                .ifPresentOrElse( stringConverterClass ->
1339                {
1340                    final var e = new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_StringConverterMismatch, setterMethodName ) );
1341                    if( !stringConverterClass.equals( stringConverterOptional.orElseThrow( () -> e ) ) ) throw e;
1342                },
1343                () -> stringConverterOptional.ifPresent( property::setStringConverterClass ) );
1344
1345            //---* Configure the setter *--------------------------------------
1346            final var checkEmptyAnnotation = setter.getAnnotation( CheckEmpty.class );
1347            final var checkNullAnnotation = setter.getAnnotation( CheckNull.class );
1348
1349            /*
1350             * The annotations @CheckEmpty and @CheckNull are mutually
1351             * exclusive, although non-empty forces also not-null.
1352             */
1353            if( nonNull( checkNullAnnotation ) && nonNull( checkEmptyAnnotation ) )
1354            {
1355                throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, CheckNull.class.getName(), setterMethodName ) );
1356            }
1357            if( nonNull( checkEmptyAnnotation ) )
1358            {
1359                if( isDefault )
1360                {
1361                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, CheckEmpty.class.getName(), setter.getSimpleName() ) );
1362                }
1363                property.setFlag( SETTER_CHECK_EMPTY );
1364            }
1365            if( nonNull( checkNullAnnotation ) )
1366            {
1367                if( isDefault )
1368                {
1369                    throw new IllegalAnnotationError( format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationOnSetter, CheckNull.class.getName(), setter.getSimpleName() ) );
1370                }
1371                property.setFlag( SETTER_CHECK_NULL );
1372            }
1373        }
1374
1375        //---* Create the setter's argument *----------------------------------
1376        final var argumentName = composeArgumentName( setter.getParameters().get( 0 ) );
1377        property.setSetterArgumentName( argumentName );
1378
1379        //---* â¦ and now we create the method spec *---------------------------
1380        final var methodBuilder = configuration.getComposer().overridingMethodBuilder( setter )
1381            .addAnnotation( Override.class );
1382        property.setSetterBuilder( methodBuilder );
1383    }   //  handleSetter()
1384
1385    /**
1386     *  Determines whether the given instance of
1387     *  {@link TypeName}
1388     *  is for an {@code Enum} type.
1389     *
1390     *  @note  This requires that the class that is represented by the
1391     *      {@code typeName} argument exists on the {@code CLASSPATH}.
1392     *
1393     *  @param  typeName    The {@code TypeName} to check.
1394     *  @return {@code true} if the given type is an {@code Enum} type,
1395     *      {@code false} otherwise.
1396     */
1397    private final boolean isEnumType( final TypeName typeName )
1398    {
1399        var retValue = false;
1400        if( typeName instanceof ClassName className )
1401        {
1402            try
1403            {
1404                final var candidateClass = Class.forName( className.canonicalName(), false, getClass().getClassLoader() );
1405                retValue = candidateClass.isEnum();
1406            }
1407            catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final ClassNotFoundException e )
1408            {
1409                /*
1410                 * Deliberately ignored; return value is already set.
1411                 */
1412            }
1413        }
1414
1415        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1416        return retValue;
1417    }   //  isEnumType()
1418
1419    /**
1420     *  <p>{@summary Parses the given CLI annotation and updates the given
1421     *  property accordingly.}</p>
1422     *  <p>{@code annotation} may be only of type
1423     *  {@link Argument}
1424     *  or
1425     *  {@link Option},
1426     *  although this is not explicitly checked (the method is private!).</p>
1427     *  <p>Usually, the method is only called by the methods
1428     *  {@link #parseArgumentAnnotation(Argument, ExecutableElement, PropertySpecImpl)}
1429     *  and
1430     *  {@link #parseOptionAnnotation(Option, ExecutableElement, PropertySpecImpl)},
1431     *  with the proper arguments.</p>
1432     *
1433     *  @param  annotation  The annotation.
1434     *  @param  method  The annotated method.
1435     *  @param  property    The property.
1436     */
1437    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1438    private final void parseCLIAnnotation( final Annotation annotation, @SuppressWarnings( "TypeMayBeWeakened" ) final ExecutableElement method, final PropertySpecImpl property )
1439    {
1440        final var annotationMirror = getAnnotationMirror( method, annotation.getClass() )
1441            .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CannotRetrieveMirror, annotation.getClass().getName() ) ) );
1442
1443        //---* The value handler class *---------------------------------------
1444        {
1445            final var name = "handler";
1446            final var annotationValue = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1447                .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoValueForMirror, annotation.getClass().getName(), name ) ) );
1448            final var handlerClass = TypeName.from( (TypeMirror) annotationValue.getValue() );
1449            property.setCLIValueHandlerClass( handlerClass );
1450        }
1451
1452        //---* The format *----------------------------------------------------
1453        {
1454            final var name = "format";
1455            getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1456                .map( v -> (String) v.getValue() )
1457                .ifPresent( v -> property.setCLIFormat( isNotEmptyOrBlank( v ) ? v : null ) );
1458        }
1459
1460        //---* The meta var *--------------------------------------------------
1461        {
1462            final var name = "metaVar";
1463            getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1464                .map( v -> (String) v.getValue() )
1465                .ifPresent( v -> property.setCLIMetaVar( isNotEmptyOrBlank( v ) ? v : null ) );
1466        }
1467
1468        //---* The multi-valued flag *-----------------------------------------
1469        {
1470            final var name = "multiValued";
1471            final var flag = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1472                .map( v -> (Boolean) v.getValue() )
1473                .orElse( FALSE )
1474                .booleanValue();
1475            if( flag ) property.setFlag( PROPERTY_CLI_MULTIVALUED );
1476        }
1477
1478        //---* The required flag *---------------------------------------------
1479        {
1480            final var name = "required";
1481            final var flag = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1482                .map( v -> (Boolean) v.getValue() )
1483                .orElse( FALSE )
1484                .booleanValue();
1485            if( flag ) property.setFlag( PROPERTY_CLI_MANDATORY );
1486        }
1487
1488        //---* The usage text *------------------------------------------------
1489        {
1490            final var name = "usage";
1491            getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1492                .map( v -> (String) v.getValue() )
1493                .ifPresent( v -> property.setCLIUsage( isNotEmptyOrBlank( v ) ? v : null ) );
1494        }
1495
1496        //---* The usage text *------------------------------------------------
1497        {
1498            final var name = "usageKey";
1499            getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, name )
1500                .map( v -> (String) v.getValue() )
1501                .ifPresent( v -> property.setCLIUsageKey( isNotEmptyOrBlank( v ) ? v : null ) );
1502        }
1503    }   //  parseCLIAnnotation()
1504
1505    /**
1506     *  Parses the given annotation and updates the given property accordingly.
1507     *
1508     *  @param  annotation  The annotation.
1509     *  @param  method  The annotated method.
1510     *  @param  property    The property.
1511     */
1512    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1513    private final void parseArgumentAnnotation( final Argument annotation, final ExecutableElement method, final PropertySpecImpl property )
1514    {
1515        property.setFlag( PROPERTY_IS_ARGUMENT );
1516
1517        //---* The index *-----------------------------------------------------
1518        property.setCLIArgumentIndex( annotation.index() );
1519
1520        //---* The other fields *----------------------------------------------
1521        parseCLIAnnotation( annotation, method, property );
1522    }   //  parseOptionAnnotation()
1523
1524    /**
1525     *  Parses the given annotation and updates the given property accordingly.
1526     *
1527     *  @param  annotation  The annotation.
1528     *  @param  method  The annotated method.
1529     *  @param  property    The property.
1530     */
1531    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1532    private final void parseOptionAnnotation( final Option annotation, final ExecutableElement method, final PropertySpecImpl property )
1533    {
1534        property.setFlag( PROPERTY_IS_OPTION );
1535
1536        //---* The name and aliases *------------------------------------------
1537        final List<String> names = new ArrayList<>();
1538        names.add( annotation.name() );
1539        names.addAll( asList( annotation.aliases() ) );
1540        property.setCLIOptionNames( names );
1541
1542        //---* The other fields *----------------------------------------------
1543        parseCLIAnnotation( annotation, method, property );
1544    }   //  parseOptionAnnotation()
1545
1546    /**
1547     *  {@inheritDoc}
1548     */
1549    @Override
1550    public final boolean process( final Set<? extends TypeElement> annotations, final RoundEnvironment roundEnvironment )
1551    {
1552        //---* Tell them who we are *------------------------------------------
1553        final var message = annotations.isEmpty() ? "No annotations to process" : annotations.stream()
1554            .map( TypeElement::getQualifiedName )
1555            .collect( joining( "', '", "Processing the annotation" + (annotations.size() > 1 ? "s '" : " '"), "'" ) );
1556        printMessage( NOTE, message );
1557
1558        final var retValue = !roundEnvironment.errorRaised() && !annotations.isEmpty();
1559        if( retValue )
1560        {
1561            if( !annotations.isEmpty() )
1562            {
1563                /*
1564                 * Get the values for the i18n annotations and keep them.
1565                 */
1566                //---* Get the message prefix *--------------------------------
1567                m_MessagePrefix = retrieveAnnotatedField( annotations, roundEnvironment, MessagePrefix.class )
1568                    .filter( variableElement -> variableElement.getModifiers().containsAll( Set.of( PUBLIC, STATIC ) ) )
1569                    .map( variableElement -> format( "%s.%s", variableElement.getEnclosingElement(), variableElement.getSimpleName() ) );
1570
1571                //---* Get the base bundle name *------------------------------
1572                m_BaseBundleName = retrieveAnnotatedField( annotations, roundEnvironment, BaseBundleName.class )
1573                    .filter( variableElement -> variableElement.getModifiers().containsAll( Set.of( PUBLIC, STATIC ) ) )
1574                    .map( variableElement -> format( "%s.%s", variableElement.getEnclosingElement(), variableElement.getSimpleName() ) );
1575
1576                /*
1577                 * Process the elements that are annotated as configuration
1578                 * bean specification. Although not more than one per
1579                 * application seems logical, it could easily be more than one.
1580                 */
1581                ScanLoop: for( final var element : roundEnvironment.getElementsAnnotatedWith( ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class ) )
1582                {
1583                    /*
1584                     * We are only interested in elements that are type
1585                     * elements, and to be honest, we only want interfaces.
1586                     */
1587                    if( element instanceof TypeElement typeElement )
1588                    {
1589                        if( typeElement.getKind() == ElementKind.INTERFACE )
1590                        {
1591                            //---* Create the configuration bean *-------------
1592                            try
1593                            {
1594                                processConfigurationBeanSpecification( typeElement );
1595                            }
1596                            catch( final IOException e )
1597                            {
1598                                printMessage( ERROR, e.toString(), element );
1599                            }
1600                        }
1601                        else
1602                        {
1603                            printMessage( ERROR, format( "%s: Only interfaces may be annotated with '%s'", typeElement.getQualifiedName().toString(), ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class.getSimpleName() ), element );
1604                            throw new IllegalAnnotationError( MSG_InterfacesOnly, ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class );
1605                        }
1606                    }
1607                    else
1608                    {
1609                        printMessage( ERROR, format( MSG_IllegalAnnotationUse, element.getSimpleName().toString(), ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class.getSimpleName() ), element );
1610                        throw new IllegalAnnotationError( ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class );
1611                    }
1612                }   //  ScanLoop:
1613            }
1614        }
1615
1616        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1617        return retValue;
1618    }   //  process()
1619
1620    /**
1621     *  Processes the given configuration bean specification and generates the
1622     *  source for the so specified configuration bean.
1623     *
1624     *  @param  specification   The specification interface.
1625     *  @throws IOException A problem occurred when writing the source file.
1626     */
1627    private final void processConfigurationBeanSpecification( final TypeElement specification ) throws IOException
1628    {
1629        //---* Create the composer *-------------------------------------------
1630        final var composer = new JavaComposer( LAYOUT_FOUNDATION, addDebugOutput() );
1631
1632        final var specificationAnnotation = specification.getAnnotation( ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class );
1633
1634        //---* Determine the simple name of the bean class *-------------------
1635        final var configurationBeanClassName = getElementUtils().getName( isEmpty( specificationAnnotation.name() ) ? format( "%sImpl", specification.getSimpleName() ) : specificationAnnotation.name() );
1636        final var isSamePackage = specificationAnnotation.samePackage();
1637
1638        //---* Do we need to synchronise the access to the properties? *-------
1639        final var synchronizeAccess = specificationAnnotation.synchronizeAccess();
1640
1641        //---* Get the base class *--------------------------------------------
1642        TypeName baseClass = null;
1643        try
1644        {
1645            final var annotationValueName = "baseClass";
1646            baseClass = getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( specification, ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class, annotationValueName )
1647                .map( TypeName::from )
1648                .orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_NoValueForMirror, ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class.getName(), annotationValueName ) ) );
1649        }
1650        catch( final NoSuchElementException e )
1651        {
1652            throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CannotRetrieveMirror, ConfigurationBeanSpecification.class.getName() ), e );
1653        }
1654        if( TypeName.from( Object.class ).equals( baseClass ) )
1655        {
1656            //noinspection AssignmentToNull
1657            baseClass = null;
1658        }
1659
1660        /*
1661         * Determine the name of the package for the bean class. As the
1662         * interface may be an inner type, we cannot just take the next best
1663         * enclosing element.
1664         */
1665        var parentElement = specification;
1666        while( parentElement.getNestingKind() != NestingKind.TOP_LEVEL )
1667        {
1668            parentElement = (TypeElement) specification.getEnclosingElement();
1669        }
1670        final var packageElement = (PackageElement) specification.getEnclosingElement();
1671        final var specificationPackageName = packageElement.getQualifiedName().toString();
1672        final var configurationBeanPackageName = getElementUtils().getName
1673            (
1674                isSamePackage
1675                ? specificationPackageName
1676                : packageElement.isUnnamed()
1677                  ? PACKAGE_NAME
1678                  : format( "%s.%s", specificationPackageName, PACKAGE_NAME )
1679            );
1680
1681        //---* Create the configuration for the code generation *--------------
1682        final var specificationClass = ClassName.from( specification );
1683        final var configuration = new CodeGenerationConfiguration( this, composer, specificationClass, configurationBeanClassName, configurationBeanPackageName, baseClass, synchronizeAccess );
1684
1685        //---* Determine the name for the initialisation data resource *-------
1686        var initDataResource = specificationAnnotation.initDataResource();
1687        if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( initDataResource ) )
1688        {
1689            if( "=".equals( initDataResource ) ) initDataResource = format( "%s.properties", specification.getSimpleName() );
1690            configuration.setInitDataResource( initDataResource );
1691        }
1692
1693        //---* Retrieve the method for the initialisation *--------------------
1694        retrieveInitDataMethod( configuration, specification );
1695
1696        /*
1697         * Retrieve all the interfaces that are implemented by the
1698         * specification.
1699         */
1700        final Set<TypeElement> interfaces = new HashSet<>();
1701        retrieveInterfaces( specification, interfaces );
1702        final var interfacesTypes = interfaces.stream()
1703            .map( element -> TypeName.from( element.asType() ) )
1704            .collect( Collectors.toList() );
1705        configuration.addInterfacesToImplement( interfacesTypes );
1706
1707        //---* Retrieve the properties *---------------------------------------
1708        retrieveProperties( configuration, interfaces );
1709
1710        //---* Add the settings for the I18nSupport *--------------------------
1711        if( configuration.implementInterface( I18nSupport.class ) )
1712        {
1713            configuration.setI18NParameters( m_MessagePrefix.orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( MSG_NoMessagePrefix ) ),
1714                m_BaseBundleName.orElseThrow( () -> new CodeGenerationError( MSG_NoBaseBundleName ) ) );
1715        }
1716
1717        //---* Determine the settings for the preferences stuff *--------------
1718        final var preferencesRootAnnotation = specification.getAnnotation( PreferencesRoot.class );
1719        if( nonNull( preferencesRootAnnotation ) )
1720        {
1721            configuration.setPreferencesRoot( preferencesRootAnnotation.nodeName() );
1722            try
1723            {
1724                getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( specification, PreferencesRoot.class, "changeListenerClass" )
1725                    .map( TypeName::from )
1726                    .ifPresent( configuration::setPreferenceChangeListenerClass );
1727            }
1728            catch( final NoSuchElementException e )
1729            {
1730                throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CannotRetrieveMirror, PreferencesRoot.class.getName() ), e );
1731            }
1732        }
1733
1734        //---* Determine the settings for the {@code INI} file stuff *---------
1735        final var iniFileConfig = specification.getAnnotation( INIFileConfig.class );
1736        if( nonNull( iniFileConfig ) )
1737        {
1738            final Path path;
1739            try
1740            {
1741                path = PathStringConverter.INSTANCE.fromString( iniFileConfig.path() );
1742            }
1743            catch( final IllegalArgumentException e )
1744            {
1745                throw new CodeGenerationError( MSG_INIPathMissing, e );
1746            }
1747            if( isNull( path ) )
1748            {
1749                throw new CodeGenerationError( MSG_INIPathMissing );
1750            }
1751            configuration.setINIFileConfig( path, iniFileConfig.mustExist(), iniFileConfig.comment() );
1752            for( final var group : specification.getAnnotationsByType( INIGroup.class ) ) configuration.addINIGroup( group );
1753        }
1754
1755        //---* Retrieve the properties *---------------------------------------
1756        retrieveProperties( configuration, interfaces );
1757
1758        //---* Create the source code *----------------------------------------
1759        try
1760        {
1761            final var generator = new CodeGenerator( configuration );
1762            final var javaFile = generator.createCode();
1763
1764            //---* Write the source file *-------------------------------------
1765            javaFile.writeTo( getFiler() );
1766        }
1767        catch( @SuppressWarnings( "OverlyBroadCatchBlock" ) final Exception e )
1768        {
1769            /*
1770             * Any exception that makes it to this point indicates a failure of
1771             * the code generation process.
1772             */
1773            printMessage( ERROR, format( "Code Generation failed: %s", e.getMessage() ), specification );
1774            throw new CodeGenerationError( format( MSG_CodeGenerationFailed, configurationBeanPackageName, configurationBeanClassName ), e );
1775        }
1776    }   //  processConfigurationBeanSpecification()
1777
1778    /**
1779     *  Retrieves the class for the preference accessor.
1780     *
1781     *  @param  accessorType    The accessor class as defined in the
1782     *      annotation; if this is
1783     *      {@link PreferenceAccessor PreferenceAccessor.class},
1784     *      the effective handler class has to inferred from the
1785     *      {@code propertyType}.
1786     *  @param  propertyType    The type of the property that should be
1787     *      accessed.
1788     *  @return The effective accessor class.
1789     *  @throws IllegalAnnotationError  There is no accessor for the given
1790     *      property type.
1791     */
1792    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.1" )
1793    private final TypeName retrieveAccessorClass( final TypeName accessorType, final TypeName propertyType ) throws IllegalAnnotationError
1794    {
1795        var retValue = accessorType;
1796        if( accessorType.equals( PREFS_ACCESSOR_TYPE ) )
1797        {
1798            //---* Infer the effective accessor class from the property type *-
1799            if( isEnumType( propertyType ) )
1800            {
1801                retValue = ENUM_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
1802            }
1803            else
1804            {
1805                retValue = switch( CollectionKind.determine( propertyType ) )
1806                {
1807                    case NO_COLLECTION ->
1808                    {
1809                        final var c = m_PrefsAccessorClasses.get( propertyType.toString() );
1810                        yield nonNull( c ) ? ClassName.from( c ) : DEFAULT_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
1811                    }
1812
1813                    case LIST -> LIST_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
1814                    case MAP -> MAP_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
1815                    case SET -> SET_ACCESSOR_TYPE;
1816                };
1817            }
1818        }
1819
1820        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1821        return retValue;
1822    }   //  retrieveAccessorClass()
1823
1824    /**
1825     *  <p>{@summary This methods checks whether the configuration bean
1826     *  specification specifies an {@code initData()} method.} This method has
1827     *  to meet the requirements below:</p>
1828     *  <ul>
1829     *  <li>the name has to be
1830     *  {@value #METHODNAME_ConfigBeanSpec_InitData}</li>
1831     *  <li>it does not take any arguments</li>
1832     *  <li>it returns an instance of {@code Map<String,Object>}</li>
1833     *  <li>it is either {@code static} or {@code default} or implemented in a
1834     *  base class, although this is not checked here</li>
1835     *  </ul>
1836     *  <p>Is such a method exists, a
1837     *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.MethodSpec}
1838     *  for it will be created and added to the configuration.</p>
1839     *
1840     *  @param  configuration   The configuration for the code generation.
1841     *  @param  specification   The configuration bean specification interface.
1842     *
1843     *  @note   If a base class for the new configuration bean is defined, the
1844     *      method may be abstract, but if that base class does not implement
1845     *      the method it will be detected only by the final compiler run, not
1846     *      by the code generation here.
1847     */
1848    @SuppressWarnings( {"TypeMayBeWeakened", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
1849    private final void retrieveInitDataMethod( final CodeGenerationConfiguration configuration, final TypeElement specification )
1850    {
1851        final var hasBaseClass = configuration.getBaseClass().isPresent();
1852        final var returnType = ParameterizedTypeName.from( Map.class, String.class, Object.class );
1853        final var method = specification.getEnclosedElements().stream()
1854            // We are only interested in methods.
1855            .filter( e -> e.getKind() == METHOD )
1856            // Methods are executable elements
1857            .map( e -> (ExecutableElement) e )
1858            /*
1859             * The method has to be either default or static; these modifiers
1860             * are mutually exclusive, so the method has either one or the
1861             * other, or it is abstract, having neither of default or static.
1862             */
1863            .filter( e -> hasBaseClass || e.getModifiers().contains( DEFAULT ) || e.getModifiers().contains( STATIC ) )
1864            // The name of the method should be "initData"
1865            .filter( e -> e.getSimpleName().contentEquals( METHODNAME_ConfigBeanSpec_InitData ) )
1866            // The method may not take any arguments
1867            .filter( e -> e.getParameters().isEmpty() )
1868            // The return type has to be Map<String,Object>
1869            .filter( e -> TypeName.from( e.getReturnType() ) instanceof ParameterizedTypeName )
1870            .filter( e -> returnType.equals( TypeName.from( e.getReturnType() ) ) )
1871            .findFirst();
1872
1873        method.map( m -> configuration.getComposer().createMethod( m ) )
1874            .ifPresent( configuration::setInitDataMethod );
1875    }   //  retrieveInitDataMethod()
1876
1877    /**
1878     *  <p>{@summary Scans the configuration bean specification for the
1879     *  properties and stores the result to the configuration.}</p>
1880     *  <p>A property is defined primarily by the respective
1881     *  {@linkplain org.tquadrat.foundation.function.Getter getter}
1882     *  method with its annotations, but it is also possible to define it by a
1883     *  {@linkplain org.tquadrat.foundation.function.Setter setter}
1884     *  method only â especially when the configuration bean specification
1885     *  extends the interface
1886     *  {@link java.util.Map}.</p>
1887     *
1888     *  @param  configuration   The code generation configuration.
1889     *  @param  interfaces  The interfaces that have to implemented by the new
1890     *      configuration bean.
1891     */
1892    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1893    private final void retrieveProperties( final CodeGenerationConfiguration configuration, final Collection<? extends TypeElement> interfaces )
1894    {
1895        final var isMap = configuration.implementInterface( Map.class );
1896
1897        /*
1898         * Retrieve getters, setters and 'add' methods from the interfaces.
1899         */
1900        final Collection<ExecutableElement> getters = new ArrayList<>();
1901        final Collection<ExecutableElement> setters = new ArrayList<>();
1902        final Collection<ExecutableElement> addMethods = new ArrayList<>();
1903        interfaces.stream()
1904            .flatMap( i -> i.getEnclosedElements().stream() )
1905            .filter( e -> e.getKind() == METHOD )
1906            .map( e -> (ExecutableElement) e )
1907            .forEach( element ->
1908            {
1909                if( isGetter( element ) )
1910                {
1911                    /*
1912                     * There is a method Map.isEmpty(); if the configuration
1913                     * bean specification extends java.util.Map, this is not a
1914                     * property getter for the 'empty' property.
1915                     * If isMap == true, the method isEmpty() will be
1916                     * implemented elsewhere.
1917                     */
1918                    if( !element.getSimpleName().toString().equals( METHODNAME_Map_IsEmpty ) || !isMap )
1919                    {
1920                        getters.add( element );
1921                    }
1922                }
1923                else if( isSetter( element ) )
1924                {
1925                    setters.add( element );
1926                }
1927                else if( isAddMethod( element ) )
1928                {
1929                    /*
1930                     * There is a method ConfigBeanSpec.addListener() that is
1931                     * necessary for the listener management, and not an 'add'
1932                     * method for a property. Therefore, it will be implemented
1933                     * elsewhere.
1934                     */
1935                    if( !element.getSimpleName().toString().equals( METHODNAME_ConfigBeanSpec_AddListener ) )
1936                    {
1937                        addMethods.add( element );
1938                    }
1939                }
1940            } );
1941
1942        /*
1943         *  Getters are to be processed first.
1944         *  This will create the properties that are stored in the
1945         *  configuration.
1946         */
1947        getters.forEach( getter -> handleGetter( configuration, getter ) );
1948
1949        //---* Process the setters *-------------------------------------------
1950        setters.forEach( setter -> handleSetter( configuration, setter ) );
1951
1952        //---* Process the 'add' methods *-------------------------------------
1953        addMethods.forEach( addMethod -> handleAddMethod( configuration, addMethod ) );
1954    }   //  retrieveProperties()
1955}
1956//  class ConfigAnnotationProcessor
1957
1958/*
1959 *  End of File
1960 */
